summary: This document is a USPS Form 1583 application and associated UPS Store agreement and receipt for a mailbox service. The application is filed by Ghislaine Maxwell on April 9, 2018, authorizing The UPS Store #5768 in Boston, MA, to receive her mail. An accompanying receipt shows a transaction on November 20, 2017, for mailbox setup and shipping services, paid with an American Express card.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the applicant filing USPS Form 1583 to authorize The UPS Store #5768 in Boston to receive her mail. She is also the customer on a receipt for mailbox services and shipping.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Listed as the cashier ('CSH') on the UPS Store receipt from November 20, 2017.

connections.description: Nathan processed a transaction for Ghislaine Maxwell at The UPS Store #5768 for mailbox services and shipping.

events.title: Mailbox Service Purchase
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell purchases a mailbox service (small size, 6-month term), pays a setup fee, and ships two packages at The UPS Store #5768 in Boston. Payment is made via American Express.

events.title: Mail Receipt Authorization Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell files USPS Form 1583, formally authorizing The UPS Store #5768 to act as her agent for receiving mail.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell established a private mailbox at The UPS Store #5768 in Boston, MA, in late 2017, with formal USPS authorization filed in April 2018.
The mailbox service was set up for a 6-month term from November 20, 2017, to May 20, 2018, indicating a period of residence or operational activity in the Boston area.
The transaction on November 20, 2017, included shipping two packages via UPS Ground Residential service, suggesting physical items were being sent from this location.
Payment for the mailbox and shipping services was made with an American Express card, providing a financial record.
The document shows Maxwell using a Boston address (02114 zip code) as her home address on the application form.
